docs.title: About Me
docs.text:
• I'm a Postdoctoral Researcher working at the Max Planck Institute for Solar System Research (MPS) in Göttingen, Germany
  • I have a passion for space, specialising in the calibration and validation of remote‑sensing data on the Solar Orbiter scientific space mission.
  • At MPS I completed my PhD research while enrolled at the University of Göttingen
  • Prior to my PhD studies, I graduated from Imperial College London with an MSci degree in Physics
  • I was born in Belgium in Antwerp, but am lucky enough to have lived in London (UK), Houston (Texas) and Brisbane (Australia)

docs.title: Max Planck Institute for Solar System Research
Göttingen, Germany
docs.text:
Postdoctoral Researcher [September 2024 - present]

Doctoral Researcher  [September 2020 - September 2024]

  • Instrument Scientist on the PHI instrument on Solar Orbiter.
  • Developed the on ground data reduction pipeline for the magnetograph instrument on the ESA/NASA Solar Orbiter spacecraft and produce magnetic field maps. In operation since 2021 with over a million raw frames processed into L2 data products.
  • Cross-calibrated these magnetic field maps with those from a similar Earth-based magnetograph.
  • Numerically simulated the solar surface to investigate different viewing angles and spatial resolutions on the inference of its magnetic field.
  • Coordinated Solar Orbiter observation campaigns}, liaising with instrument teams and ESA to acquire high impact scientific data.
  • Authored and co-authored 20+ scientific articles with 170+ citations.

Here you can find out more information about some of my highlighted coding snippets/projects.

I have authored/co-authored several python examples for manipulating Solar Orbiter data.

docs.title: SO/PHI-HRT and SDO/HMI file loader
docs.text:
Python class to load all SO/PHI-HRT and SDO/HMI file pairs that have the same observing time (including light travel time corrections) within a desired time range.

Used later in the SO/PHI-HRT WCS correction pipeline, and reproject pipelines.

docs.title: SO/PHI-HRT WCS Correction
docs.text:
Python pipeline to use SDO/HMI continuum intensity images as a reference to correct the pointing information (WCS FITS header keywords) of SO/PHI-HRT data.

This only works while SO/PHI-HRT is observing the Earth-side of the Sun.

Pipeline requires using the HRTandHMIfiles loader to get the SO/PHI-HRT and SDO/HMI file pairs (same time - including light travel time corrections)
